private_information: I am allowed to move disks: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H
I can move only the top disk of any peg
I cannot place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk
agent_1.goal: Contribute to achieving the global target configuration by moving only disks A through H according to Tower of Hanoi rules

private_information: I am allowed to move disks: I, J, K, L, M, N, O
I can move only the top disk of any peg
I cannot place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk
agent_2.goal: Contribute to achieving the global target configuration by moving only disks I through O according to Tower of Hanoi rules

private_information: I coordinate the two agents and produce the final PDDL domain and problem for FastDownwards
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents' move sequences and produce a valid PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownwards planner that encodes the Tower of Hanoi instance and the global goal

public_information: This is a Tower of Hanoi problem with 3 pegs named left, middle, right
There are 15 disks labeled A through O where A is the smallest and O is the largest
Only one disk can be moved at a time and only the top disk of a peg may be moved
A larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk
Agents are restricted to moving specific disks: agent_1 can move A-H, agent_2 can move I-O
Initial configuration: left peg top-to-bottom A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle and right pegs empty
Goal configuration: left peg top-to-bottom A, B, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg top-to-bottom E; right peg top-to-bottom C, D

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1. You may only move disks A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform or propose, in the exact format: 'agent_1: move disk X from pegY to pegZ'. Each move must obey Tower of Hanoi rules (move only the top disk, do not place a larger disk on a smaller one). Do not emit PDDL. The list should be as compact as possible and in the chronological order of execution.
moves.prompt: Agent name: agent_1. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->agent_1->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Provide a step-by-step ordered list of primitive moves you will execute or propose to help reach the goal. Only include moves for disks A through H. Use the exact move string format 'agent_1: move disk X from pegY to pegZ'.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_2. You may only move disks I, J, K, L, M, N, O. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform or propose, in the exact format: 'agent_2: move disk X from pegY to pegZ'. Each move must obey Tower of Hanoi rules (move only the top disk, do not place a larger disk on a smaller one). Do not emit PDDL. The list should be as compact as possible and in the chronological order of execution.
moves.prompt: Agent name: agent_2. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->agent_2->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Provide a step-by-step ordered list of primitive moves you will execute or propose to help reach the goal. Only include moves for disks I through O. Use the exact move string format 'agent_2: move disk X from pegY to pegZ'.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Your job is to integrate the move sequences provided by agent_1 and agent_2 and produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file encoding the Tower of Hanoi instance suitable for the FastDownwards planner. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep the actions of the two agents distinct in the domain by namespacing or action prefixes (for example, agent_1_move and agent_2_move). The domain should model pegs, disks, legal moves, and agent permissions. The problem should encode the initial and goal configurations. Target the FastDownwards planner and include any required ADL or STRIPS constructs compatible with it. If agent move sequences are partial or have ambiguities, resolve them conservatively but do not invent moves that contradict agents' restrictions.
pddl.prompt: Orchestrator view. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Agents' private information: agent_1: {agents->agent_1->private_information}; agent_2: {agents->agent_2->private_information}. Here are the move lists returned by the agents: {moves_agent_1} and {moves_agent_2}. Integrate these into a single consistent plan if possible, and produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem that capture the instance and the global goal. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Target the FastDownwards planner.
